questions.answer_description: Working software is the primary measure of progress.
questions.question_text:
A Scrum Master teaches those who are interested in the Development Team's progress that progress in Scrum comes from inspecting an Increment at the Sprint
Review.
What is the most appropriate action for the Scrum Master to take if the Product Owner is having difficulties managing the Product Backlog?

choices.A: Have the Development Team order the work instead of the Product Owner.
choices.E: Delay the Sprint in order for the Product Owner to have enough time to prioritize the Product Backlog.
choices.C: Offer the Product Owner help in understanding that the goal of ordering the Product Backlog is to maximize the flow of value.
choices.D: Delegate the work to the Assistant Product Owner.
choices.B: Have the Product Owner order the items based on size, having the Development Team work on the smallest items first.

questions.answer_description: The Product Owner's primary concern is the flow of value reflected in the ordering of the Product Backlog.

choices.B: Suggest reducing the frequency of the Retrospectives.
choices.A: Start facilitating more productive and useful Retrospectives.
choices.C: Extend the Sprint time-box in order to fit the Retrospectives.

questions.question_text: What action should a Scrum Master take if the Development Team has decided that Retrospectives are no longer necessary?

choices.C: There should be five Product Backlogs and one Product Owner to manage them.
choices.A: There should be five Product Owners, one for each Scrum Team.
choices.D: There should be five Product Backlogs and five Product Owners.
choices.B: The product has one Product Backlog and one Product Owner.

questions.question_text: As a Scrum Master, what would you strive for if five new Scrum Teams were to work on one product?
questions.answer_description: For a single product there is one Product Backlog. For a single Product Backlog there is one Product Owner.

choices.D: Notify the team responsible for system performance.
choices.A: Coach the Product Owner on effective ways to communicate this concern to the Development Team and encourage the Product Owner to add the performance issue to the Product Backlog.
choices.B: Tell the Product Owner performance is defined by the Development Team.
choices.C: Note the issue for the next Sprint Retrospective.
